div.l: Wel bet is roten appul out of horde
Than þat it rotie al þe remenaıı̄unt
So fareth it bi a riotous ʆseruᵃaunt
It is ful lasse harme to late it pace
Than he shende alle þe ʆseruᵃauntes in þe place
Therfore his maister gaf him aquitaıı̄unce
And bad him goo with sorow and myschaıı̄unce
And þus þis Ioli prentis had his leue
Now lat him riote al þe night or leue
And for þ̉er nys no thef withouten alowke
That helpeþ him to wasten and to sowke
Of þat he bribe can or borowe may
Anon he sent his bed and his array
Vnto a conꝑpere of his owne sorte
That louede dis reuel and disporte
And hadde a wif þat helde for contenaıı̄unce
A shoppe and swyued for hire sustenaıı̄unce
HEre begynneþ þe cokes tale . Gamelyn .
LIthen and lestneþ and herkeneþ a right
And ye shul heren of a doughti knight
Sir Iohn of Boundis was his name
He coude of norture and mochel of game
Thre sones þe knight had ⁊and wᵗith his bodi he hem wan
The eldest was a moche shrewe and sone he began
His broþern loued wel hir fader and of him were agast
The eldest deseruid his fader curs and had it at last
The good knight his fader lyued so yore
That deþ was comen him and handlid him ful sore
The good knight cared sore sike þẻre he lay
How his children shulde lyuen after his day
He had ben wide wher but noon husbond he was
Alle þe londe þat he had it was verray purchas
Fayn he wolde it were drissed among hem all
